00035 //
00036 // Predefined slider types
00037 //
00038 #define FRAC_SLIDER 1    // 0.0...1.0
00039 #define DB_SLIDER 2      // -36...36 dB
00040 #define PAN_SLIDER 3     // -1.0...1.0
00041 #define SPEED_SLIDER 4  // 0.01 ..3.0 
00042 
00043 // Customizable slider only: If stepValue is STEP_CONTINUOUS,
00044 // every value on the slider between minValue and maxValue
00045 // will be possible
00046 //
00047 #define STEP_CONTINUOUS 0.0f
00048 
00049 //
00050 // Lightweight slider - i.e. a slider that doesn't appear in
00051 // its own window, but rather draws itself inside an existing
00052 // window (used inside Track Labels).  The ASlider class,
00053 // which uses this class, is below.
00054 //
00055 class LWSlider
00056 {
00057    friend class ASlider;
00058    friend class ASliderAx;
00059 
00060  public:
00061 
00062    // MM: Construct customizable slider
00063    LWSlider(wxWindow * parent,
00064        wxString name,
00065        const wxPoint &pos,
00066        const wxSize &size,
00067        float minValue,
00068        float maxValue,
00069        float stepValue,
00070        bool canUseShift,
00071        int style,
00072        bool heavyweight=false,
00073        bool popup=true
00074        );
00075     
00076    // Construct predefined slider
00077    LWSlider(wxWindow * parent,
00078             wxString name,
00079             const wxPoint &pos,
00080             const wxSize &size,
00081             int style,
00082             bool heavyweight=false,
00083             bool popup=true);
00084 
00085    void Init(wxWindow * parent,
00086              wxString name,
00087              const wxPoint &pos,
00088              const wxSize &size,
00089              float minValue,
00090              float maxValue,
00091              float stepValue,
00092              bool canUseShift,
00093              int style,
00094              bool heavyweight,
00095              bool popup,
00096              float speed
00097    );
00098 
00099    virtual ~LWSlider();
00100

00103 
00104    float Get( bool convert = true );
00105    void Set(float value);
00106 
00107    void Increase(int steps);
00108    void Decrease(int steps);
00109 
00110    // If set to less than 1.0, moving the mouse one pixel will move
00111    // the slider by less than 1 unit
00112    void SetSpeed(float speed);

00276 class ASliderAx: public wxWindowAccessible
00277 {
00278 public:
00279    ASliderAx(wxWindow * window);
00280 
00281    virtual ~ ASliderAx();
00282 
00283    // Retrieves the address of an IDispatch interface for the specified child.
00284    // All objects must support this property.
00285    virtual wxAccStatus GetChild( int childId, wxAccessible** child );
00286 
00287    // Gets the number of children.
00288    virtual wxAccStatus GetChildCount(int* childCount);
00289 
00290    // Gets the default action for this object (0) or > 0 (the action for a child).
00291    // Return wxACC_OK even if there is no action. actionName is the action, or the empty
00292    // string if there is no action.
00293    // The retrieved string describes the action that is performed on an object,
00294    // not what the object does as a result. For example, a toolbar button that prints
00295    // a document has a default action of "Press" rather than "Prints the current document."
00296    virtual wxAccStatus GetDefaultAction( int childId, wxString *actionName );
00297 
00298    // Returns the description for this object or a child.
00299    virtual wxAccStatus GetDescription( int childId, wxString *description );
00300 
00301    // Gets the window with the keyboard focus.
00302    // If childId is 0 and child is NULL, no object in
00303    // this subhierarchy has the focus.
00304    // If this object has the focus, child should be 'this'.
00305    virtual wxAccStatus GetFocus( int *childId, wxAccessible **child );
00306 
00307    // Returns help text for this object or a child, similar to tooltip text.
00308    virtual wxAccStatus GetHelpText( int childId, wxString *helpText );
00309 
00310    // Returns the keyboard shortcut for this object or child.
00311    // Return e.g. ALT+K
00312    virtual wxAccStatus GetKeyboardShortcut( int childId, wxString *shortcut );
00313 
00314    // Returns the rectangle for this object (id = 0) or a child element (id > 0).
00315    // rect is in screen coordinates.
00316    virtual wxAccStatus GetLocation( wxRect& rect, int elementId );
00317 
00318    // Gets the name of the specified object.
00319    virtual wxAccStatus GetName( int childId, wxString *name );
00320 
00321    // Returns a role constant.
00322    virtual wxAccStatus GetRole( int childId, wxAccRole *role );
00323 
00324    // Gets a variant representing the selected children
00325    // of this object.
00326    // Acceptable values:
00327    // - a null variant (IsNull() returns TRUE)
00328    // - a list variant (GetType() == wxT("list"))
00329    // - an integer representing the selected child element,
00330    //   or 0 if this object is selected (GetType() == wxT("long"))
00331    // - a "void*" pointer to a wxAccessible child object
00332    virtual wxAccStatus GetSelections( wxVariant *selections );
00333 
00334    // Returns a state constant.
00335    virtual wxAccStatus GetState(int childId, long* state);
00336 
00337    // Returns a localized string representing the value for the object
00338    // or child.
00339    virtual wxAccStatus GetValue(int childId, wxString* strValue);
00340 
00341 };
